Specific Details: On 25th April 2016, a letter and map was sent to all TDs in the Offaly Constituency to inform them of the revised proposed layout for Cloncreen Wind Farm. Copies of this letter and map were also circulated to the general public in the vicinity of the proposed wind farm.

Intended Results: All members of Dáil Éireann for the constitutency in which the proposed Cloncreen Wind Farm would be located have access to information on the proposed layout.

Specific Details: Submission to Carol Nolan on the consultation process regarding the NEPS service.
Subject Matter: Submission to Carol Nolan on the consultation process regarding the NEPS service.
Intended Results: 1. NEPS should regularly meet with advocacy/stakeholder groups like DAI to share practice & promote positive partnership.  2. NEPS should produce written evidence-based guidance on dyslexia assessment, & also on how the needs arising from dyslexia can best be met in school.  3. NEPS should continue to deliver ongoing training & support to schools to create dyslexia-friendly schools.  4. NEPS should ensure that all resource allocation models reflect best-practice guidance on assessment.
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Donald Ewing, DAI's Head of Psychological & Educational Services

Specific Details: Young farmer and rural youth issues relevant to County Laois
Subject Matter: Young farmer and rural youth issues relevant to County Laois
Intended Results:
Leasing of land and the need to keep the tax free allowance on same. 
::Discussed the need for the grant on derelict buildings to continue and to be given longer time to get application completed. 
::Discussed the need for sex semen to be tax free. 
Discussed the need for Farm safety to be a priority in the tax free equipment and to training. 
::Discussed the need for farm succession training and a medium to be available for farmers both the old generation and the young farmers. Discussed land mobility and what it intales and how it helps farmers. And the need to fund same. 
::Discussion on the need to look at GP practices and how it can be reformed to prevent GP running out in the rural area. 
We discussed make a move and its importants in rural Ireland as a mental health. And the need to fund same. We discussed sex health and the need for eduction and contraception to be rolled out to over 26 to 35.'
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Shelia Fitzpatrick Laois Macra National Council Representative

Specific Details: Zoetis is significantly expanding its biotech production facility in Tullamore (County Offaly). The animal health products will benefit cats and dogs in markets around the world. DPOs Lobbied: Pippa Hackett|Minister of State|Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine::Carol Nolan|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Barry Cowen|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas

Intended Results: Get acceptance for biotech animal health production in Ireland and County Offaly. Discuss future development with minister and TDs.

Specific Details: Contact made to know what parties intentions are with regards to IOP's physics aims and goals
DPOs Lobbied: Carol Nolan|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Annie Hoey|Senator|Seanad::Pauline O'Reilly|Senator|Seanad::Aisling Dolan|Senator|Seanad
Subject Matter: Contact made to know what parties intentions are with regards to IOP's physics aims and goals
Intended Results: Inclusion of physics related content in parties policies and manifestos, in particular in relation to furthering our aims with regard to physics in the scientific, societal and skills make up of the fabric of Ireland and it's future.
Lobbying Activities: I made contact a number of times to gauge interest in the subject matter with this T.D. and also to try to arrange a meeting face to face with that T.D.|Email|2-5::I contacted Annie Hoey of Labour as a Science spokesperson in order to have an idea of inclusion of this topic for their intentions in their upcoming manifesto|Email|1::I contacted Pauline O'Reilly of the Green Party to ask if they are considering physics based issues in their green energy policies which will in turn link to their manifestos|Email|2-5::I contacted Aisling Dolan who is a spokesperson on Science matters in Fianna Fáil to try to get a further indication with the party as to the level of interest in physics related matters and whether they have them included in their manifestos.|Email|1
